name: Shredded Chicken Tacos
author: Goya
summary: Bone and skin are left on the chicken breasts so they're extra flavorful as they simmer in tomato sauce and a blend of savory seasonings.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Goya Extra Virgin Olive Oil
Goya Adobo with Pepper, to taste
1 (10 ounce) package Goya Corn Tortillas, warmed
¼ cup finely chopped white onion
directions: In medium bowl, mix together tomato sauce, vinegar, garlic, chili powder, cumin, oregano, and sugar
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook chicken, turning once, until light golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes
Add reserved tomato sauce mixture to pan; bring to a boil (be careful, the tomato sauce can splatter)
Simmer, covered, until cooked through (thermometer will register 170 degrees F when inserted into thickest part of breast), flipping once, about 20 minutes
Transfer chicken to cutting board; reserve sauce in pan
Remove and discard bones and skin
Using two forks, shred chicken breast
Transfer chicken to skillet with sauce, mixing to combine; continue to cook until sauce reduces and blends into chicken, and mixture begins to caramelize, about 10 minutes more
Transfer chicken mixture to serving bowl
Garnish with lettuce, tomatoes, avocados and/or onions, if desired
Sprinkle with hot sauce, if desired
